reviews.review: A soulless, unentertaining piece of tripe.

This movie is abnormally cliche, fails to deliver, and predictable. It is like the flipped version of Inside Out. It basically throws the clich√© concept of finding your place in the world, which is a good idea for kids, but the storytelling fails to deliver. It also throws in unnecessary jokes that  failed to amuse the audience as they popped out of nowhere. Even worse, they added in the "emoji pop"  which is a  cringe worthy dance where you cover your face and show an expression and you cover your face again and show another one, and so on.

A time-waster, subjective, not funny, boring and stressful movie that is plagued with lots and lots of advertising. This is the worst movie of 2017 so far and maybe the worst animated movie aswell. It's full of contradictions, stereotypes and is an inciter to not live the real life, to keep stuck in a cellphone and to solve any real-life problem with an emoji. The world doesn't work like this and the people either. I don't know what the directors were thinking about this would be a good movie.

Ok, this film isn't offensively bad, but rather a blatant ripoff of both Wreck It Ralph AND The Lego Movie. It's just insulting to older adults who aren't familiar with the apps shown, and treats its target audience like they are 3 years old. There are some clever moments, with how the worlds of some apps are portrayed. You will sigh and roll your eyes a LOT more than you will find yourself genuinely -- not sarcastically --  laughing. This is just a simple, bad film.
I took the kids on 8-7-2017 and we laughed it was funny. I say go see it before you judge it And i say it was a pretty good movie.

I knew this movie was going to suck when it was announced I mean seriously a Emoji Movie that's just stupid I mean lego movie sounded dumd when it was announced but that movie was good this movie is bad its just advertisement that's all it is advertisement I have no more to say
the movie is just a rip off of inside out and wreck it ralph, with a little of pixels dragged inside it. It truly is one of the worst
Best movie of the century! It was the perfect combination of wreck it ralph and inside out! I could watch it 1000 more times! It is a must see movie!

This movie provides a refreshing, much needed motivational thematic drive, quite void from most movies today. 
In the "Emoji Movie", the character of "Meh" provides a well defined motive of striking out against the conforming norm of what he's expected to be by his fellow "Emoji's". Speaking volumes in how greatly he wished to strive from under his famous father's shadow, "Meh" takes little time before figuring out that the truest of identities is that of friendship and trust. 

My son was so moved by this movie, that we've begun to sew up a "Poop emoji" suit for him for Halloween this year, as to help define himself from the rest of his friends.

If you haven't already, take your kids to go see this movie!

A truly beautiful creation, a joy to watch! The Emoji Movie is a brilliant piece of work, with fantastic comedic timing and brilliant jokes scattered throughout the movie. 5 stars is way too little, I would give it 10 star emojis out of 5. Exquisite.
